codeExamples.name: Embedded signing ceremony
codeExamples.description: This example sends an envelope, and then uses an embedded signing ceremony for the first signer. With embedded signing, the DocuSign signing ceremony is initiated from your website.

codeExamples.name: Send an envelope with a remote (email) signer and cc recipient
codeExamples.description: The envelope includes a pdf, Word, and HTML document. Anchor text (AutoPlace) is used to position the signing fields in the documents.

codeExamples.name: List envelopes in the user's account
codeExamples.description: The envelopes' current status is included.

codeExamples.name: Get an envelope's basic information
codeExamples.description: The example lists the basic information about an envelope, including its overall status.

codeExamples.name: List an envelope's recipients
codeExamples.description: Includes current recipient status.

codeExamples.name: Listing envelope documents
codeExamples.description: This code example demonstrates how to retrieve a list of all documents within a specific envelope.

codeExamples.name: Downloading envelope documents
codeExamples.description: The example can download individual documents, the documents concatenated together, or a zip file of the documents.

codeExamples.name: Programmatically create a template
codeExamples.description: This code example demonstrates how to create a new DocuSign template using the eSignature API.

codeExamples.name: Send an envelope using a template
codeExamples.description: This code example demonstrates how to generate a new envelope from an existing template.

codeExamples.name: Send an envelope and upload its documents with multpart binary transfer
codeExamples.description: Binary transfer is 33% more efficient than using Base64 encoding.

codeExamples.name: Embedded sending
codeExamples.description: Embeds the DocuSign web tool (NDSE) in your web app to finalize or update the envelope and documents before they are sent.

codeExamples.name: Embedded DocuSign web tool
codeExamples.description: Embeds the DocuSign web tool (NDSE) in your web app

codeExamples.name: Embedded signing ceremony from a template with an added document
codeExamples.description: This example sends an envelope based on a template. In addition to the template's document(s), the example adds an additional document to the envelope by using the Composite Templates feature.

codeExamples.name: Payments example: an order form, with online payment by credit card
codeExamples.description: This code example demonstrates how to create an envelope that enables the recipients to also submit a payment when signing the envelope.

codeExamples.name: Get the envelope tab data
codeExamples.description: Retrieve the tab (field) values for all of the envelope's recipients.

codeExamples.name: Set envelope tab values
codeExamples.description: The example creates an envelope and sets the initial values for its tabs (fields). Some of the tabs are set to be read-only, others can be updated by the recipient. The example also stores metadata with the envelope.

codeExamples.name: Set template tab values
codeExamples.description: The example creates an envelope using a template and sets the initial values for its tabs (fields). The example also stores metadata with the envelope.

codeExamples.name: Get the envelope custom field data (metadata)
codeExamples.description: The example retrieves the custom metadata (custom data fields) stored with the envelope.

codeExamples.name: Requiring an access code for a recipient
codeExamples.description: This example sends an envelope that requires an access-code for the purpose of multi-factor authentication.

codeExamples.name: Requiring SMS authentication for a recipient
codeExamples.description: This example sends an envelope that requires entering in a six digit code from an text message for the purpose of multi-factor authentication.

codeExamples.name: Requiring phone authentication for a recipient
codeExamples.description: This example sends an envelope that requires entering in a voice-based response code for the purpose of multi-factor authentication.

codeExamples.name: Requiring Knowledge-Based Authentication (KBA) for a recipient
codeExamples.description: This example sends an envelope that requires passing a Public records check to validate identity for the purpose of multi-factor authentication.

codeExamples.name: Requiring ID Verification (IDV) for a recipient
codeExamples.description: This example sends an envelope that requires submitting a photo of a government issued ID for the purpose of multi-factor authentication.

codeExamples.name: Creating a permission profile
codeExamples.description: This example creates a new permission profile that can be assigned to users in the DocuSign account.

codeExamples.name: Setting a permission profile
codeExamples.description: This example applies an existing permission profile to a group of users in the DocuSign account.

codeExamples.name: Updating individual permission settings
codeExamples.description: This example updates the settings of an existing permission profile.

codeExamples.name: Deleting a permission profile
codeExamples.description: This example deletes a permission profile.

codeExamples.name: Creating a brand
codeExamples.description: This example creates a new brand that can be used to customize the user experience of envelopes in the DocuSign account.

codeExamples.name: Applying a brand to an envelope
codeExamples.description: This example creates a new envelope and applies an existing brand to that envelope.

codeExamples.name: Applying a brand and template to an envelope
codeExamples.description: This example creates a new envelope from a template and also applies an existing brand to it.

codeExamples.name: Bulk sending envelopes to multiple recipients
codeExamples.description: This example sends an envelope to multiple recipients by using the DocuSign Bulk Send feature.
